extraction.intervention: person-centred general practitioners (GP) consultations using MADRS-S
extraction.notes: Remission defined as BDI-II score ≤13 at 3-month follow-up. Text reports 49% remission in intervention and 47.3% in TAU; event counts calculated as 0.49*125 and 0.473*133 and rounded to nearest whole number.

extraction.intervention: person-centred general practitioners (GP) consultations using MADRS-S
extraction.notes: From Table 2: at 12-month follow-up, 52/125 (42%) in intervention and 51/133 (38%) in TAU had prescriptions for sedatives.

extraction.intervention: person-centred general practitioners (GP) consultations using MADRS-S
extraction.notes: From Table 3: mean total duration of sick leave (days) over 0–12 months among those with any sick leave. Number of individuals with sick leave: 49 (39%) intervention, 64 (48%) TAU. Group sizes for the trial were 125 and 133, respectively.

extraction.intervention: person-centred general practitioners (GP) consultations using MADRS-S
extraction.notes: From abstract and Table 2: at 6-month follow-up, 86/125 (69%) in intervention vs 78/133 (59%) in TAU were on antidepressants.

extraction.intervention: person-centred general practitioners (GP) consultations using MADRS-S
extraction.notes: Outcome measured with BDI-II. Article reports no significant difference in mean intra-individual change between groups at 12 months, but exact means/SDs are not provided in text or tables.

extraction.outcome: change in quality of life 12 months
extraction.intervention: person-centred general practitioners (GP) consultations using MADRS-S
extraction.notes: Outcome measured with EQ-5D. Article states no significant differences in mean intra-individual change between groups at 12 months; exact numeric values not reported.

extraction.intervention: person-centred general practitioners (GP) consultations using MADRS-S
extraction.notes: Outcome measured with GHQ-12. Figures show trajectories but no exact means/SDs; text reports no significant differences in mean intra-individual change between groups over 12 months.
